content.title: Harvesting Tools Assistance for Scheduled Tribes (HRT-3)
content.department: Directorate of Horticulture, Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat
content.beneficiary: Farmers belonging to the Scheduled Tribes category, FPOs, FPCs, FIGs, SHGs, and Cooperative Societies
content.details: The scheme 'Harvesting Tools Assistance for Scheduled Tribes (HRT-3)' provides financial assistance to farmers belonging to the Scheduled Tribes category as well as to FPOs (Farmers Producer Organizations), FPCs (Farmers Producer Companies), FIGs (Farmer Interest Groups), SHGs (Self-Help Groups), and Cooperative Societies for purchasing harvesting tools.
benefits: Scheduled Tribes farmers will be eligible for assistance up to 50% of the cost of the harvesting tool or ₹1,00,000/-, whichever is less.
FPO/FPC/FIG/SHG/Cooperative Society will be eligible for assistance of 75% of the cost of the harvesting tool or ₹1,50,000/-, whichever is less.
eligibility: The beneficiary should be a permanent resident of Gujarat.
The beneficiary should belong to the Scheduled Tribe category.
The individual farmer or FPO/FPC/FIG/SHG/Co-operative society is eligible to avail of benefits under the scheme.
The assistance will be available once in five years.
Equipment certified by ISO/BIS/ISI/Government-Recognized organizations should be purchased through an authorized dealer of that company or imported equipment.
documents_required: Scheduled Tribes certificate issued by competent authority
Disability Certificate from Competent Authority (only for PWDs) (if applicable)
Copy of bank passbook or cancelled cheque
Copy of Forest Rights letter (if applicable)
Samanti Form (for partners holding land in joint name) (if applicable)

In case of FPO/FPC, Co-operative Society, documents relating to registration purpose, activities, constitution, members, etc., and audit report of the last one year of the auditable entity (if applicable)

faqs.question: Who can benefit from the scheme?
faqs.answer: Scheduled Tribes farmers as well as Farmers Producer Organizations (FPOs), Farmers Producer Companies (FPCs), Farmer Interest Groups (FIGs), Self-Help Groups (SHGs), and Cooperative Societies are eligible for assistance under this scheme.

faqs.question: What are the benefits of the scheme for Scheduled Tribes farmers?
faqs.answer: Scheduled Tribes farmers can receive assistance up to 50% of the cost of the harvesting tool or ₹1,00,000/-, whichever is less.

faqs.question: What benefits are available for FPOs/FPCs/FIGs/SHGs/Cooperative Societies under the scheme?
faqs.answer: These organizations are eligible for assistance of 75% of the cost of the harvesting tool or ₹1,50,000/-, whichever is less.

faqs.question: Is there a limit on the cost of the harvesting tool eligible for assistance?
faqs.answer: Yes, the unit cost of the harvesting tool should be up to ₹2,00,000/- to qualify for assistance under the scheme.

faqs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for beneficiaries of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries must be permanent residents of Gujarat and belong to the Scheduled Tribe category.

faqs.question: Can individual farmers and organizations both avail benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, both individual farmers and organizations like FPOs/FPCs/FIGs/SHGs/Cooperative Societies are eligible to avail benefits under the scheme.

faqs.question: How often can a beneficiary avail assistance under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Assistance under the scheme can be availed once in five years.

faqs.question: Are there any specific requirements for the equipment purchased under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Equipment should be certified by ISO/BIS/ISI/Government recognized organizations and purchased through an authorized dealer of that company or imported equipment.

faqs.question: How can one apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Applicants can apply online through the I-Khedut Portal: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/

faqs.question: Can applicants track their application status online?
faqs.answer: Yes, applicant can also check their Application Status/View/Print/Upload Application details from the below link: https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/public/frm_Applicant_Corner.aspx
